Summary Note:
The RM has known Lang Schmid Schnell since childhood, as their families have been close friends for many years. This long-standing relationship has fostered a deep trust and understanding between them.
Having worked for over 46 years, Lang Schmid Schnell brings a wealth of experience and expertise to his current role. He is known for his strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
Julius Baer's personalized approach and dedication to client success were key factors in his decision to join.
Family Background: Lang Schmid Schnell is married to Lena. They do not have any children.
Education Background:
Lang completed his secondary education at Lycée Français de Vienne in 1975.
In 1980, Lang graduated from Graz University of Technology with a degree.
Occupation History:
With a career spanning nearly 46 years, Lang Schmid Schnell has established himself as a key player in the industry.
At Leopold Museum, Lang Schmid Schnell held the position of Art Dealer from 1979 to 1983, developing essential skills in the field.
In 1984, he moved to Belvedere Museum to work as a Gallery Owner, applying his knowledge to achieve outstanding performance.
He spent 29 years working as a Art Advisor at Leopold Museum, refining his expertise and building a strong network.
Wealth Summary:
During his work, he focused on financial growth, making diverse investments and ultimately saving 1280000 EUR.
He has townhouse located in Zwettl, worth 1090000 EUR.

In addition to his primary residence, he owns condo in Gmunden worth 790000 EUR.

On top of that he inherited a beautiful villa in Spittal an der Drau, which could be used as a weekend getaway. It is valued at 2120000 EUR.
He does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: Given the client's impressive career history and financial discipline, we are confident in his ability to achieve financial success and security.
